summary: The Cormorant Relief Act of 2025 mandates the Secretary of the Interior to reissue a specific depredation order concerning double-crested cormorants and aquaculture facilities. The reissued order expands the application to include additional states (California, Colorado, Connecticut, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Michigan, Missouri, New Jersey, Ohio, Pennsylvania, and Wisconsin) and extends coverage to lake and pond managers alongside existing entities. The bill references Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, stating the document is in the public domain and not subject to copyright.
